item.title: About
item.description: Ira is a graduate research assistant in the department of Wildlife, Fisheries, and Aquaculture as well as the Animal Dairy Sciences at Mississippi State University. Growing up on the family farm in Northeast Kansas, Ira developed a love and passion for animals, the outdoors and nature. He received his bachelors from Kansas State University in 2015, where he majored in Feed Science and Management. Driven by a desire to learn and pursue a career with animals, he joined the class of ’17 at Texas A&M in College Station, where he received his Master of Science in Animal Science.

item.title: Contact

item.title: CV
item.description: Ira Lloyd Parsons Mississippi State University, Thomson Hall · Mississippi State, MS 39762 · 913-565-0896 · ilp28@msstate.edu Education Doctor of Philosophy in Forest Resources, Mississippi State University December 2022 concentration: Wildlife, Fisheries and Aquaculture, GPA 4.00 Mississippi State University, Mississippi State, Mississippi, 39762 Dissertation Title: Animal Husbandry in the 21 st Century: Understanding beef cattle grazing systems ecology using precision technology_ Chapters: Thesis Objective: Demonstrate prospective uses of tracking collars and accelerometers to study fine-scale movement and behaviors related to animal cattle growth/production, energy expenditure, and pasture space use given landscape resource distribution.

Efficacy of statistical process control procedures to identify deviations in continuously measured physiologic and behavioral variables in beef steers experimentally challenged with Mannheimia haemolytica. Characterization of feeding behavior traits in steers with divergent residual feed intake consuming a high-grain diet.
